front.title: Open Network Handles Implemented in DNS

abstract.t: An Open Network Handle System (ONHS) provides an intermediate levelof service between IP numbers and domain names. A handle adherespermanently to an owner, who may assign and reassign it to dif-ferent addresses at will. But a handle is a number, carrying nosignificance in natural language. Any user desiring a handle maygenerate one from a public key. This memo describes a simple imple-mentation of an Open Network Handle System using the securityextensions to the Domain Name System (DNSSEC).
